document.masterDocTitle: Pamphagidae (Orthoptera: Acridoidea) from the Palaearctic Region: taxonomy, classification, keys to genera and a review of the tribe Nocarodeini I. Bolívar

subSubSection.paragraph: Type locality. Nakhichevan: Paşalı. Holotype: female (ZIN).

Material examined.
NAKHICHEVAN : Pashalu [ Paşalı ] 40 km , S. Nakhich. ,
11.7.1934
, 1♀ ( Holotype ), 2♀ ( Paratypes ) (leg. Margarita Ter-Minasiyan ) ( ZIN )
;
AZERBAIJAN : Vadi Araxia , Ara ,
25.5.1923
, 1♀ ( Holotype of
Paranocarodes aserbeidshanicus
), 1♀ ( Paratype of
Paranocarodes aserbeidshanicus
) ( Mus . Armen. Exped. Arax. 1923) ( MfN )
;

Distribution. Nakhichevan : Paşalı, Armania: Zangezur, Kotaik, Megry, Gegard, Arax Valley,
Azerbaijan
: Arax Valley, N.W. Iran :
Azerbaijan
, Ardebil provinces and
Georgia
( Fig. 842 ).

Remarks. Ramme (1951) described
Paranocarodes aserbeidshanicus
after two females. I had the opportunity to compare it with the rich material of
P. margaritae
in the ZIN .
P. aserbeidshanicus Ramme
has a slightly smaller body and yellow hind tibia, but some specimens of
P. margaritae
collected from Arax Valley have a similar body size and yellow tibia or basal half of the tibia yellow, turning to reddish apically in some. Moreover both taxa are found in the same valley Arax, Nakhichevan . After the comparison with the type specimens I have concluded that both taxa are synonyms.

On the label of
P. aserbeidshanicus
there is the word “ara”. Ramme (1951) correctly recorded it as “Aza (Arastal)” in Nakhichevan .
